### Learning objectives (15' class)

The students should...

* ...understand that `ggplot2::ggplot()` and `plot()` are two functions that we can use to make graphics in R.

* ...recognize that Tidyverse and base R have different R syntax 

---

### The students are familiar with...

* Basics of R programming
* RStudio IDE
* RMarkdown
* The use of R packages
* Tidyverse

### In this course we are going to learn `ggplot2` 

---

### Why to use `ggplot2`?


.pull-left[

‚úîÔ∏è **Layered grammar of graphics** 

The syntax of the code involves only important decisions that directly impact a user‚Äôs interpretation of the data

‚úîÔ∏è **It is easier to get good quality plots for publication** 

]

.pull-right[

```{r ggplot11, fig.height=6, fig.width=6, echo=FALSE, message = FALSE, warning = FALSE}
ggplot(diamonds, aes(x = carat, y = price, col = cut)) +
    geom_point(alpha = 0.2) +
    scale_color_viridis_d(direction = -1) +
    geom_smooth(method = "gam")+
    theme_classic()
```

]

.footnote[[Why I use ggplot2](http://varianceexplained.org/r/why-I-use-ggplot2/) - David Robinson]
